text:
Hi All

I was wondering if anyone had any luck page breaking in quotes?
Its cool, I have got it now :slightly_smiling_face: :slightly_smiling_face:

Wondering if anyone knows for the Sitemaps that HubSpot adds to from published blogs posts, is there a programmatic way to remove blog posts or webpages from the XML sitemaps? We are trying to improve SEO, and have a bunch of pages that should not be appearing there, it would be great to programmatically remove them? On a similar note, with blogs is there way to completely prevent published blog posts from showing up on the XML sitemap?

We have in our robots.txt to disallow:
```Disallow: /us/insights/news/*
Disallow: /emea/insights/news/*
Disallow: /apac/insights/news/*```
but we need to use it for HubSpot search so we added this below it:

```User-agent: HubSpotContentSearchBot
Allow: /us/insights/news/*
Allow: /emea/insights/news/*
Allow: /apac/insights/news/*```
But we want to completely remove it from our XML sitemap but there are over 1000 entries, wondering if there a bulk way or programmatic way to do this, in XML sitemap, we are still seeing entries like this:

<url>
<loc><https://mydomain.com/us/insights/news/sweeping-regulations-like-californias-upcoming-privacy-bill-threaten-to-wipe-out-the-advertising-industry></loc>
<lastmod>2021-03-27</lastmod>
</url>

:sparkles:Slack Tips and Best Practices:sparkles:

To get the most out the HubSpot Developer Slack, follow these best practices:

• Will your post/question potentially help more than one person? Ask in a public channel instead of 1:1 DMs to help as many folks as possible. 
• Thread all replies to keep topics organized and searchable
• Thread followup questions/comments to your original post
• Don't post the same question in multiple channels. If you must, link to your original question in new channels.
More <https://slack.com/blog/collaboration/etiquette-tips-in-slack|great tips here>. Thanks for making the HubSpot Developer Slack easier to use for everyone!
